alert.note: Alert for Adair; Boone; Dallas; Greene; Guthrie; Madison; Polk (Iowa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued April 04 at 5:26PM CDT until April 04 at 6:15PM CDT by NWS DesMoines
info.description: The National Weather Service in Des Moines has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... West central Polk County in central Iowa... Southeastern Greene County in west central Iowa... Northwestern Madison County in south central Iowa... Eastern Guthrie County in west central Iowa... Southwestern Boone County in central Iowa... Eastern Adair County in southwestern Iowa... Dallas County in central Iowa... * Until 615 PM CDT. * At 526 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located near Greenfield, moving northeast at 65 mph. HAZARD...Ping pong ball size hail and 60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...People and animals outdoors will be injured. Expect hail damage to roofs, siding, windows, and vehicles. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * This severe thunderstorm will be near... Stuart around 540 PM CDT. Earlham, Dexter and Diamondhead Lake around 545 PM CDT. Other locations in the path of this severe thunderstorm include De Soto, Redfield, Adel, Waukee, Dallas Center, Minburn, Bouton, Granger and Woodward. This includes Interstate 80 between mile markers 86 and 113. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.50 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM CDT for central, south central, southwestern and west central Iowa.

area.areaDesc: Adair; Boone; Dallas; Greene; Guthrie; Madison; Polk
